input: ### Here is the essay text: Will newspapers become a thing of the past ?The internet has been more and more popular for recent years , providing people with a huge source of information . As a result of this , print media such as newspapers have experienced a dramatic decline in the number of readers . Some people , however , still believe that they can exist for long time ; others disagree , arguing that <AC1> newspapers have lost their competitive advantage to sustain their prolonged existence </AC1> . Personally , I am inclined to agree with the latter view for following reasons .First of all , <AC2> to obtain information , using the internet is quicker and more convenient than reading newspapers </AC2> . <AC3> Contrary to the past when people had to wait long hours to take a daily newspaper , nowadays , they can acquire latest news updated every second through their mobile phones or computers connected to the internet , everywhere and at anytime </AC3> . <AC4> As can be seen , these devices and machines are very common in all parts of the world , making it easier for people to read a number of things that newspapers can not provide in only some pages </AC4> . Hence , <AC5> the print media has failed to keep its important role in the provision of information </AC5> .Another point is that , <AC6> from the economic aspect , buying newspapers appears to be a waste of money when the internet becomes available for every one </AC6> . It is clear to recognize that <AC7> the internet service is being provided at a low cost or even free in many countries </AC7> . The question arises as to whether or not a person spends an extra money buying newspapers to receive the same , even usually less information than those he can have with the internet ? <AC8> The answer , perhaps , is that hardly would rational people do so </AC8> . For this reason , <AC9> the number of people reading newspapers may continue falling sharply , possibly leading to the close - downs of many in the coming time </AC9> .Last , but not least , <AC10> when taking environment into consideration , people must conceive that the more newspapers are published , the more trees are cut down </AC10> . <AC11> This is simply the contributor to the deforestation which is happening all over the world today </AC11> . At this point , <AC12> newspapers ' production will have to face environmentalists on its way to be alive </AC12> .In conclusion , it might be unpleasant for some advocating newspapers to witness the extinction of the type of media . However , this , if occurring , should be seen as a result of the ever - increasing innovations in media technology and in our modern life as a whole .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Government shouldn ' t put money on building theaters or sports stadiumsHow to allocate governmental budget efficiently has always been a hot topic of discussion among the public . Recently , some people argue that <AC1> government should invest more on medical care and education rather than on entertaining or sports facilities </AC1> . As far as I am concerned , this proposal is beneficial more to the society .<AC2> Taking care of thousands of citizens who suffer from disease or illiteracy is more urgent and pragmatic than building theaters or sports stadiums </AC2> . As a matter of fact , <AC3> an uneducated person may barely appreciate musicals , whereas a physical damaged person , resulting from the lack of medical treatment , may no longer participate in any sports games </AC3> . Therefore , <AC4> providing education and medical care is more essential and prioritized to the government </AC4> .<AC5> Entertaining facilities such as cinemas , theaters and sports stadiums are mostly profit - oriented </AC5> . <AC6> Their existences are based on their marketing strategies , the condition of facilities and the volume of audience </AC6> . <AC7> The competition among each of these facilities is an inevitable part of the free market , which should not be interfered by government </AC7> . Instead , <AC8> the establishment of medical facilities or educational institutes is aimed to improve the health or education standard rather than earning profits , which deserves more funds from government </AC8> .Furthermore , <AC9> putting taxpayers ' money on building theaters or sports stadiums is unfair to those who cannot use them </AC9> . For example , <AC10> not everyone is a fan of watching musicals on the spot </AC10> . Therefore , <AC11> it is a bit inappropriate to use the majority of citizens ' tax funds to meet a minority of people ' s needs </AC11> . That is the reason why <AC12> sectors such as medical care and education deserve more governmental support </AC12> , because <AC13> they are accessed by every individual in our society on a daily basis </AC13> .To summarize , I strongly agree that <AC14> budgets should be allocated more on medical care and education rather than on building entertaining facilities </AC14> , because <AC15> the former is more essential , non - profit oriented to the public and can be accessed by the majority of citizens </AC15> .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Economic development vs environmentCurrently , a great number of countries have pushed forward their economies by developing national industries . However , some people are worried that the economic targets in industrialized countries may be attained at the expense of the ecosystems . From my perspective , I think <AC1> flourishing economies can go hand in hand with environmental preservation </AC1> .Admittedly , <AC2> some countries may place economic developments ahead of environmental protection , thus ruining the local environments </AC2> . As <AC3> these needy countries lack adequate financial and human resources , advanced technologies and experience </AC3> , <AC4> they have to rely on natural resources to maintain their living standards </AC4> . Besides , <AC5> people in the poverty - stricken areas are not likely to be equipped with knowledge to preserve the ecosystems </AC5> . As a result , <AC6> unchecked and reckless uses of the local raw materials may happen , which can put a strain on the natural resources </AC6> . In this view , <AC7> the economic development and environmental protection can be conflicting </AC7> .However , I believe <AC8> the booming economy can be closely linked to the preservation of the environment </AC8> . <AC9> With people raising their awareness of the green economy , the products free of pollutants are increasingly prevalent among clients , which means eco - friendly businesses can make a favorable impression on customers today , triggering sales </AC9> . For example , <AC10> electronic bicycles powered by clean energy resources have been well received among people in recent years </AC10> .Furthermore , <AC11> taking environmental consequences seriously can enhance working efficiencies </AC11> . <AC12> If a firm is environmentally conscious , it may have to make optimal use of its resources to improve its production lines and equipment , which can boost productivity </AC12> . Therefore , <AC13> it may spur its economic development </AC13> . On the other hand , <AC14> without the requirement of environmental preservation , the firm would still consume a vast amount of energy which constitutes a large part of its operational costs , being a hurdle to the economic development </AC14> .Therefore , I would conclude that <AC15> thriving economies and the preservation of ecosystems can be promoted simultaneously </AC15> . On the other hand , I suppose the developed countries should support the underdeveloped areas by providing financial resources , technologies and experience so that the environmental problems can be effectively alleviated in these areas .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Should wealthy nations support poor ones ?Whether wealthy nations should take responsibilities to help poorer ones , by means of providing infrastructures , or remain bystander of the global poverty , is an issue of controversy . input: ### Here is the essay text: University education is needed for successIn today ' s modern and competitive society , it is undeniable that we must equip ourselves with plenty of knowledge and skills in order to shine and to be successful in life . input: ### Here is the essay text: Fossil fuels will soon be replaced ?Although renewable resources of energy are elements of the current and future energy strategy , as far as I ' m concerned , these <AC1> new forms of energy cannot soon replace fossil fuels such as gases , oil , and coal </AC1> .Firstly , <AC2> due to the limitation of technology renewable resources are relatively expensive </AC2> . <AC3> Researches in renewable energy cost a huge amount of money which developing countries cannot afford </AC3> . More importantly , <AC12> the accumulation of heavy metal in the silt on the bottom of the rivers behind the dams is extremely difficult and expensive to clean up ; leaving problems for the following generations </AC12> . input: ### Here is the essay text: Should we pay professional athletes ( entertainers ) a high salary ?Professional athletes and entertainers earn a huge amount of money that is hard to imagine . Most of the people spending their whole life can never achieve this . This salary gap between those famous people and us leads to a question - do those professional athletes and entertainers deserve this money ? From my prospect , I believe that <AC1> they do deserve this high payment </AC1> .First of all , <AC2> a worker ' s salary can properly reflect his / her competence and value on his / her career </AC2> . Therefore , <AC3> those who are paid high salaries must exceed others and achieve something incredible in certain ways </AC3> . <AC4> They are not paid for no reason </AC4> . <AC5> As we are now live in a competent world , we must show ourselves to be great enough so as to convince the employer that we deserve a better payment </AC5> . <AC6> It ' s all the same in every profession </AC6> . That ' s why <AC7> the richest athletes usually correspond to the greatest athletes in their fields , namely Michael Jordan or Tiger Woods </AC7> .Second , <AC8> such high salaries can also guarantee and support the athlete ' s great performances </AC8> . <AC9> Most of us only see the luxurious side of a rich athlete and ignore how may difficulties they ' ve gone through and how much cost they ' ve thrown into investing themselves </AC9> . <AC10> They shall reap within their high salaries </AC10> . In other words , <AC11> if they are not paid high enough in order to conform to their performances , there might not be such brilliant performances for us to be amazed </AC11> .Some people might argue that <AC12> the gap between the rich athletes and normal people is so huge that it seems to be unfair </AC12> . However , in my opinion , <AC13> as long as everyone has equal chances to pursue his / her dreams and careers , that would be fair </AC13> . <AC14> Fairness is not about equal payments for everyone , but equal chances to acquire the same goal or accomplishment </AC14> .In conclusion , <AC15> high salary for athletes is what they deserve in accordance with their own achievements and also a guarantee for quality performances </AC15> . <AC16> It is a positive encouragement for many more talented people to contribute to the world of athletics and entertainment , giving us awesome performances to enjoy </AC16> .

input: ### Here is the essay text: How teachers can make the subject interesting to students !There are many ways of teaching . Some people believe that strictly and carefully presenting theories in the class is the best way of teaching , while others assert that involving applications on that theory will be more convincing . In my opinion , I agree with the second idea that <AC1> the best way for teachers to make students more interested in a subject is to explain how that subject can help and apply to their lives outside school </AC1> .First of all , <AC2> by explaining how the subject contributes to daily life , students will have vivid impression on that subject thus become more interested and active in acquiring the knowledge on that subject </AC2> . <AC3> Take chemistry for example , merely memorizing the names of the substances and the structural formulas seems to be very boring , while representing where and how those chemical reactions really happen near students will raise their curiosity and lead them to digest those theories learned from the class </AC3> . <AC4> While I was in senior high school , my chemical teacher once showed us how the detergent dissolves oil by an experiment and later on taught us how to describe this process with formal structural formulas </AC4> . <AC5> This type of learning method is more fun and eventually the results are good </AC5> . <AC6> I connected the visual images of that experiment with the formula and I barely forget , even though now I ' m not studying chemistry anymore </AC6> .Second , <AC7> by bridging the theories with daily life events , students are given the chance to apply knowledge to their lives and develop their own ability of problem - solving </AC7> . <AC8> This will address students ' interests </AC8> because <AC9> it ' s the assignment that needs real life participation </AC9> . For example , <AC10> in law class , students are informed their rights and duties and they are taught how they can apply law to different situations that might happen upon them </AC10> . <AC11> When any one of the situations occurs , they can think independently and figure out how to react </AC11> .In conclusion , <AC12> using life experiences and examples to demonstrate the knowledge on a subject is an effective way to attract students ' attention and keep them eager on learning </AC12> , not only because <AC13> it reinforces students ' impression on the knowledge but also invites students to practice the knowledge out on their own </AC13> .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Once you are unique enough , you are already on the way to successAchieving success is everybody ' s goal for life and there are absolutely many different directions that can lead people to success . Take myself for example , <AC6> when I was in college , I was always chosen to be the presenter of group report </AC6> because <AC7> I was the only one in my group who could present the report thoroughly and fluently </AC7> .Second , <AC8> being unique can create your own value which can never be taken by others </AC8> . In other words , <AC9> once you are special and unique , pursuing success is a matter of actively creating the fashion rather than passively waiting for other people to recognize and appreciate you </AC9> . <AC10> Take the most popular and prestigious technology company - Apple - for example </AC10> . <AC11> The reason why it gains such a tremendous success is because it achieves some brilliant qualities that can never be caught up by other competitors </AC11> . <AC12> It has its operating systems that can run smoother than any other companies and its design always wins the popularity among consumers </AC12> . <AC13> It is the uniqueness of Apple design that creates its own value </AC13> .In conclusion , <AC14> being different and unique is the better way to achieve success </AC14> . <AC15> It not only shows your competence but also creates your own value , making you take the lead in your way towards success </AC15> .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Spending equal amount of money on libraries and sports ?University students can be divided into two groups , one group with less interest to study and the other which include hard working students . But <AC1> I don ' t think that equal amount of money should be spent on academic issues like libraries and laboratories and physical or social activities </AC1> .First , in my view <AC2> spending too much money for equipping the gyms or constructing football / basketball courts are really not necessary to encourage students to do sports </AC2> . For example , <AC3> my roommate , Mary , always wakes up 6 in the morning and spends 1 hour doing sport in the park which is near our dormitory </AC3> . <AC4> When she gets to the dorm , she is really full of energy and after taking a shower , she is ready to start a good day </AC4> . As you see , <AC5> she is doing exercise without spending a cent </AC5> . <AC6> What the university should do is informing the students the benefits of doing sport by hanging some posters in the campus , inviting some athletes to lecture for students and encourage them to spend some time for their body and health </AC6> .In addition , <AC7> students choose their major based on their interests </AC7> . <AC8> The university should provide the best equipment needed for physical education students </AC8> . Because <AC9> their major in completely involved in physical activities </AC9> . In contrast , <AC10> for an engineer or a medicine student I do not find it fair enough to equip gyms instead of their laboratories </AC10> , because <AC11> it really make the students enthusiastic to use innovative technology to learn and maybe find new things in their field </AC11> .Finally , <AC12> spending money on social activities looks like wasting money </AC12> . <AC13> For students who want to gather with their friends or want to go out to meet new people , university programs are the last place they would choose </AC13> . input: ### Here is the essay text: Human needs vs saving land for endangered animalsIn the past centuries the population steadily grew and now , for the first time in history , is exceeding seven billion . To illustrate , <AC5> every day a massive part of the Rainforest in South America is destroyed to provide wood and farmland </AC5> . <AC6> If we don ' t preserve this important part of our ecosystem many endangered animals will loose their natural habitat and go extinct </AC6> . As a result , <AC7> further generations will never have the opportunity to see and study these animals </AC7> .In addition , <AC8> a stable and sustainable environment is essential for the weather </AC8> . <AC9> Our behavior causes pollution , which heavily affects the weather conditions on planet Earth and causes the undoubtedly Global Warming </AC9> . <AC10> This not only affects the endangered animals , but also the humans </AC10> because <AC11> we are affected by the increasing sea level and the climatic changes </AC11> . For example , <AC12> recent studies from the United Nations Organization have shown that , till 2050 the sea level will increase over one meter in the average </AC12> . <AC13> This will dramaticly affect all people living near the coast and change the global climate </AC13> .In conclusion , there is to say that , given the arguments above , <AC14> we definitely have to change our behavior towards the environment , not only to preserve the endangered animals but also to preserve our own living conditions </AC14> .

Despite the argument of some people that <AC1> learners can obtain more useful knowledge from teachers than from other sources </AC1> , I firmly believe that <AC2> both alternative sources and traditional teaching methods from educators are equally important in children ' s acquisition of knowledge </AC2> .It is undeniable that <AC3> the widespread of alternative sources of knowledge has played an important role in students ' acquisition of knowledge </AC3> . <AC4> Computers can be programmed to provide an endless numbers of questions in diverse range of fields , and as the students answer these questions , the facts has been learned and reinforced </AC4> . <AC5> A case in point is the reading and listening parts of TOEFL iBT exams , as candidates have to answer many questions in a limited period of time </AC5> . Moreover , <AC6> when students have some academic problems , they can post those to some websites and receive correct answers from unknown people in faraway places without any costs </AC6> . Besides , <AC7> in the past , conducting a research require long hours of searching in library shelves , now all can be done at a click of a button </AC7> . Thus , <AC8> technologies are vital in students ' learning </AC8> .On the other hand , <AC9> schools and university are places in which students gather to be educated and learn from each others as well as formal educators </AC9> . <AC10> At schools , students ' development has been orchestrated stage by stage , step by step by experienced teachers , and their acquisition of knowledge is guided and backed up in a systematic way </AC10> . Therefore , <AC11> formal education approaches are also indispensable </AC11> .To put it all in a nutshell , I pen out saying that <AC12> alternative sources information and traditional education systems are equally important in children ' s development </AC12> . So students should learn both from their teachers as well as modern technology to gain the best learning outcome .

input: ### Here is the essay text: A more convenient life in a cityThere are undeniable advantages to both life in a big city and in a small town . input: ### Here is the essay text: Spending time with a large number of friends can add more to one ' s lifeDespite friendship is one of the most important values in a man ' s life , people might have different preferences : some of them prefer to spend time with one or two close friends , while <AC1> other prefer to be surrounded by a large number of friends </AC1> . input: ### Here is the essay text: Follow the New Customs of the New Country or Not ?When people move to another country , most likely , they will face the choice between following the customs of the new country or keeping their original one . As for me , <AC1> I would follow the new customs , if I migrated to another country </AC1> .On one hand , <AC2> it will be easier for people to assimilate into a new country , if they follow the new customs </AC2> . <AC3> When people migrate to a new country , they are likely to suffer the culture shock , because of the difference between two cultures </AC3> . <AC4> The custom is just a form of the culture and following the custom is a good way to know more about this culture </AC4> . For example , <AC5> if one wore in white and went to common Viharas to observe a rather longer - than - usual , full - length Buddhist sutra in Buddha ' s Birthday in India , he or she would learn something about Indian religion and culture </AC5> . As a result , <AC6> people understand the culture , and then they adapt to the new country </AC6> .On the other hand , <AC7> keeping own customs stably might cause discrimination </AC7> . <AC8> When people insist to keep their own customs and refuse to accept the new one , they regard themselves as a special group in the new country </AC8> . <AC9> The local people may also regard them as a special group as well and separate them from the main - stream society </AC9> . <AC10> One example of this is that the Chinese immigrants in Indonesia in 1969 </AC10> . <AC11> They formed Chinatown and kept Chinese language and customs in it </AC11> . <AC12> While the Indonesians stopped working at 4 : 00 pm and went home for rest , Chinese immigrants were still working </AC12> . Although <AC13> being much richer than local people , they faced the discrimination </AC13> . <AC14> Their houses and private cars were buried by local people </AC14> , because <AC15> the locals were jealous of Chinese people , who had so much wealth , which should have been theirs </AC15> . <AC16> If the Chinese immigrants had followed the local customs and assimilated into Indonesia , they would not have been regards as a group of Chinese and discrimination might have been alleviated </AC16> .All in all , <AC17> the immigrants should follow the customs in the new country </AC17> , which can help them survive from the culture shock sooner , and assimilate to a new culture .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Classmates ' impacts on children ' s performance at schoolIt goes without saying that no pupil can succeed at school unassisted . However , in my opinion , <AC1> the classmates should be regarded as the most important influence on individual achievements </AC1> .To begin with , <AC2> the classmates themselves creat a competitive atmoshphere which incent the children </AC2> . <AC3> In high school , for instance , an individual cannot resist studying painstakingly through day and night when the others who are astoundingly ambitious and set sights on prestigious universities around the globe are doing the same </AC3> . <AC4> From a psychological perspective , the feeling of being subordinate to their peers exert enormous pressure on the children , which subsequently transforms into some sort of stimulants and boosts the children ' s academic performances </AC4> .To add up , <AC5> when it comes to knowledge and the acquisition of such , classmates are second to none </AC5> . It is a matter of fact that <AC6> students share even more time together than with their parents , explaining a great deal of wisdom they absorb from each others </AC6> ; <AC7> it can be , for example , lessons on the class , social skills or general etiquettes that are sometimes overlooked by parents </AC7> . <AC8> Sharing the same age , children are at their most comfort to exchange ideas , to query and interpret abstract concepts without fear of parental punishments , resulting in deeper comprehension </AC8> .All advantages considered , <AC9> classmates are unrivalled by the children ' s parents </AC9> as <AC10> they provide tremendous incentive and horizon expansion , two crucial commodities leading to a successful presentation at school </AC10> .

input: ### Here is the essay text: Keeping animals in zoosSince the time they were introduced zoos have both been supported and criticized . Many believe that zoos could be very entertaining and ecologically important , whereas , others think that keeping animals in captivity is totally wrong . Both sides will be discussed before a reasonable conclusion is drawn .First , critics of zoology argue that <AC1> keeping animals in captivity is wrong </AC1> because <AC2> animals should be considered non - human persons and they should have the right of having freedom </AC2> . <AC3> This is so unfair for them to be taken out of their natural environment and to be kept in small enclosures </AC3> . That is because , <AC4> many zoos , especially the ones in developing countries , do not provide care and attention which their animals require </AC4> . <AC5> The animals are often undernourished and do not have sufficient quality and quantity of medical treatment </AC5> . In addition , <AC6> sometimes animals from hot countries have to survive in the cold winter of somewhere in Europe </AC6> .On the other hand , the advocators believe that <AC7> zoos provide the public with good entertainment and also help to ensure the balance of the ecology </AC7> . <AC8> Many people , especially young children enjoy going to zoos and see their favorite animals , cute baby - born animals and the animals that are from the different corners of the world </AC8> . <AC9> Zoos provide educational information about the lives of different animals to the public </AC9> . Also , <AC10> zoos play an important role in reserving many breeds of animal and preventing them from being missing from life </AC10> . This is due to the fact that , <AC11> in zoos , animals are kept in enclosures which simulate their own habitats and also endangered animals are being protected from their predators or hunters </AC11> . Thus <AC12> zoos are needed to keep the nature balanced </AC12> .In conclusion , <AC13> both of the arguments have strong supports </AC13> , but in my own view , <AC14> more good come from zoos than bad </AC14> . However , it is hoped that the standards of zoos should be leveled up to ensure that the animals in zoos are provided with good care and attention .

input: ### Here is the essay text: A greater proportion of the budget should be allotted to education and prevention issuesIn today ' s world , the concept of the welfare state requires governments to provide sustainable healthcare and health education to their citizens . input: ### Here is the essay text: The biggest risk is not taking any risk" The biggest risk is not taking any risk ." For instance , <AC5> some people abandon their job , family and friends and go to other country without knowing what the future holds for them </AC5> . <AC6> In the beginning , it can be tough to fit in this new place and find any opportunity </AC6> , but <AC7> after fighting against the obstacles blocking the way to get what is desired ; it is possible to conquer what they are craving as well as start to build a new life in this other country </AC7> .In fact , <AC8> many people are afraid to take risks and fail </AC8> . <AC9> It is possible to get frustrate along the way </AC9> , but <AC10> it is vital to never give up on your dream </AC10> . To illustrate , <AC11> Walt Disney , whose career is famous , had a challenging life </AC11> . <AC12> One of the difficulties was some of his histories , such as Mickey Mouse and Three Little Pigs , were turned down </AC12> . <AC13> He heard lots of " no ", furthermore one editor fired him alleging that he had no imagination , after all what he had gone through , he never stop chasing his dreams </AC13> .To conclude , <AC14> in this competitive world you have to be fearless and face all new situations </AC14> . input: ### Here is the essay text: The maintenance of traditional skills and ways of life ?There is no doubt the application of technological developments in some countries will be accompanied with modern skills and new lifestyles . It is argued that these so - called cultural invasions will result in the distinction of national traditions , and there is no need to maintain them . However , from my point of view , <AC1> what can be expected , is a change of the role of the tradition but not its disappearance from the society </AC1> .It is undeniable that <AC2> the country ' s culture is passed down mainly through traditional skills and ways of life </AC2> . For instance , <AC3> in Vietnam , many water puppet shows which once demonstrated our seasonal agriculture and communal activities , are today substituted by cinemas and music concerts </AC3> . This means <AC4> the young generation can solely get access to their ancestor ' s early life through books and images , which otherwise would be much more easily absorbed </AC4> .In tradition , <AC5> a person should look back at the past , mainly by means of custom handcraft or antique lifestyle , to progress </AC5> . <AC6> Understanding why , and how our predecessors survived through thick and thin will probably be invaluable lessons for us today </AC6> . Also , <AC7> study form their mistakes helps us accomplish our goal with smooth sailing </AC7> .To sumarize , <AC8> there should never be any replacement for traditional skills or ways of life </AC8> . <AC9> They are the ones that teach , and will teach us to be self - esteem and experienced , which means their preservation throughout history deserve our attention </AC9> .
